Detailed Description

Calibration constants for the Calice ECAL detector modules.

Based on LCFixedObject.

Author:
Goetz Gayckem, LLR - ecole polytechnique)
Version:
$Id $

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CALICE::EcalModuleCalibration::EcalModuleCalibration ( LCObject *  obj  )  [inline]

C'tor to be used for elements of LCGenericObjects read from an LCIO file or the database.

Subclasses should 'override' this, e.g.:
Myclass(LCObject* obj) : EcalModuleCalibration(obj) {}

Member Function Documentation

UInt_t CALICE::EcalModuleCalibration::getModuleID (  )  const [inline]

Get the unique module ID.

A module is uniquely identified by the module ID (serial number) and the module type.

Definition at line 62 of file EcalModuleCalibration.hh.

std::string CALICE::EcalModuleCalibration::getModuleTypeName (  )  const [inline]

Get the name assigned to the module type.

The module type together with the module ID is considered to be unique. Due to the character encoding in an integer array, the function may perform slowly.

EcalModuleCalibration& CALICE::EcalModuleCalibration::setCalibrationConstant ( UInt_t  cell_index,
float  calibration_constant 
) [inline]

Set the calibration constant of thye given cell.

Parameters:
cell_index the cell index (electrical order: first the values of the first sample from all chips, then the second sample from all chips etc.)
calibration_constant the calibration constant which is multiplied to the ADC value.
